projects.name: XPRESSOO
projects.summary: A vehicle rental platform designed for college students.
projects.description: A vehicle rental platform for college students who do not own private vehicles. Enables easy vehicle rentals, reducing reliance on overcrowded public transport. Designed an intuitive UI using HTML & CSS with plans for further enhancements post-hackathon.
projects.problem: College students often struggle with transportation, relying on overcrowded public transport or expensive ride-sharing services.

projects.name: NUTRILYF
projects.summary: Customized diet recommendation app with intelligent meal plans.
projects.description: A platform to promote healthy living through personalized meal plans and food recommendations. Integrated user input-based suggestions tailored to health conditions and fitness goals. Developed using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
projects.problem: People struggle to maintain healthy eating habits due to lack of personalized guidance and meal planning tools.

projects.name: GLOBEWAYY
projects.summary: Interactive tourism map of India with AI-driven itinerary generation.
projects.description: A clickable map of India designed to enhance tourism engagement. Provides state-wise tourism details, including categorized attractions. Planned AI-based itinerary generation for a personalized travel experience.
projects.problem: Tourists struggle to plan comprehensive trips across India due to scattered information and lack of personalized recommendations.

projects.name: GREEN CART
projects.summary: Platform connecting local vendors with customers.
projects.description: A platform to connect local vendors with customers, promoting local businesses. Aims to bridge the gap between vendors and buyers for seamless access to goods/services. Developed using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
projects.problem: Local vendors struggle to reach customers online, while buyers find it difficult to discover and support local businesses.
